column4: oh i meant to ask - does ubuntu5 support the nforce2 chipset by default?
yeah i've noticed that myself on a few distros
i was hoping that it had been sorted :(
just modprobe foredeth and you're settled
well, what i want to do is remote-boot an nforce2 system from a server that's not nforce2 :)
meh we'll cross the bridge when we get there :)
it's most likely not a k related issue
a restart shouldnt be needed iirc
i _think_ it loads the list every time you access it
but i haven't used OOo in a long time
